full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement: Urinalysis Collection Services**

**Reference Number:** cb-837-48354086
**Tender Number:** 21883-24-0005
**Closing Date:** February 12, 2024, 17:00:00

The Correctional Service Canada, Pacific Region, invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the provision of Urinalysis Collection Services in the Abbotsford and Maple Ridge areas.

**Background:**
This requirement is for the collection of urine samples from federally released offenders. The contractor is expected to ensure the integrity of the samples and maintain confidentiality and non-disclosure of the donor's identity.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collect urine samples from offenders upon referral
* Ensure samples are collected in compliance with Section 66 (1) of the Correctional Service of Canada's regulations
* Maintain chain of custody and prepare samples for shipment to an approved laboratory
* Provide non-scheduled collections with 24 hours' notice, unless specified otherwise
* Comply with the Correctional Service of Canada's policies and procedures
* Provide a detailed invoice and urinalysis log sheets monthly

**Technical Requirements:**
The contractor must have experience in collecting urine samples and maintaining confidentiality. They must also possess the necessary equipment and training to ensure the integrity of the samples.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Bidders will be evaluated based on their ability to meet the technical requirements, lowest price, and the level of service provided.

**Contract Details:**
The contract will be for a period of one year, with an option to renew for three additional one-year periods. The expected contract start date is April 1, 2024, and the expected contract end date is March 31, 2025.

**Selection Criteria:**
The lowest price will be the sole selection criterion. Suppliers must submit their bids in accordance with the solicitation document and associated documents, available on the Canada Buy Service website.

**Note:**
The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.

**Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) Seminars:**
Free seminars are available for businesses interested in learning about the federal government contracting process. Topics include searching for opportunities, bidding, and registering in supplier databases. The full schedule of seminars can be found on the Buy and Sell Government of Canada website.
